name: Create a testing harness for testing the TUI
description:
I'd like to add a testing harness to be able to perform complex tests on the TUI, like opening the diff, adding comments, moving to a different file etc. This harness will help us to build an extensive testing suite. I'd also like to have some form of snapshot testing where after performing some actions, I'd like to take a snapshot with all the current state, like syntax highlighting, selected file etc. and compare it with later runs to ensure there aren't any unintentional changes.

UPDATE: The test harness has been implemented in src/test_harness.zig. It provides:
- TestRunner: wraps UI for headless testing with configurable dimensions
- Snapshot: captures text, styles, and UI state (mode, cursor, file, etc.)
- serialize/deserialize: for storing and comparing snapshots
- sendKey/sendChar: for simulating user input
- compare: diffs two snapshots and reports differences

Remaining work is to add comprehensive tests using the harness (see child tasks).
result:
Testing harness fully implemented with comprehensive test suite:

✓ Test infrastructure (test_harness.zig):
  - TestRunner: headless UI testing with configurable dimensions
  - Snapshot: captures UI state (text, styles, cursor, file, mode, etc.)
  - Serialization/deserialization for snapshot comparison
  - Key simulation (sendKey, sendChar, directional keys)
  - Surface diff comparison

✓ 59 existing unit tests covering:
  - Cursor movement (up/down/home/end/page movements)
  - Selection system (shift+arrows, selection persistence)
  - Mode transitions (normal, comment, file_list, help, etc.)
  - Comment submission (single/multiline, empty comments)
  - View mode toggling (split/unified)
  - File list navigation
  - Rendering snapshots
  - Edge cases (empty files, many files, wrapping)

✓ 8 comprehensive integration tests for user workflows:
  1. Review workflow (open/navigate/comment/export)
  2. Multi-file review (switch files with comments)
  3. Collapse workflow (summary mode with comments)
  4. Selection workflow (multi-line selection)
  5. View toggle workflow (split to unified)
  6. File list workflow (jump to file)
  7. Cancel workflow (escape without submit)
  8. Focus side workflow (toggle old/new sides)

All 173 tests pass successfully.

commit.message: feat: add comprehensive TUI test suite with 59 tests

name: Summary view should collapse Zig test blocks
result: Added support for collapsing Zig test blocks in summary view by adding 'test_declaration' to the classifyZigNode function in collapse.zig. Tree-sitter uses this node type for Zig test blocks. Added a test to verify test declaration detection.

name: Summary view on the diff
description: I'd like to present a summary of the changes currently reviewed. Since agents can be verbose on generating code, I'd like to be able to present as much as semantic information in the summary view with the minimal bloat. Summary view should show how many files are changed, how many functions are changed in each file, how many new structs/classes are added etc. Summary view should also work a the file level and function/class/struct level as well, showing summary of what changed more granular level

name: Ability to stage changes
description: Currently, we can only add comments to reviewed lines, but we should be able to stage code blocks that look good and doesn't require any changes. That way, the operator can incrementally stage blocks to drain pending changes. Ideally there should be a new action "Stage" that can be used selected lines similar to "Comment" and "Ask"

name: Show minimap on the file diff
Ability to filter out cosmetic changes
description: Since agents are good/bad at generating lots of cosmetic changes, and reviewers only care about semantic changes on the logic, I'd like to have a mode where rv tries to collapse cosmetic changes like code comments, variable renames, moving functions from one place to another etc.

name: Ability to review newly created files
Create initial CI setup
description: Create a GitHub CI workflow that triggers on each push to main and runs `zig build test --summary all`
result: Created GitHub Actions CI workflow at .github/workflows/ci.yaml that runs 'zig build test --summary all' on push to main, pull requests, and merge groups. Uses mlugg/setup-zig@v2 for Zig toolchain and ubuntu-latest runner.

name: Add cursor movement tests

name: Add integration tests for user workflows
description:
Test complete user workflows end-to-end. Key scenarios:

1. Review workflow: Open diff → navigate to change → add comment → export markdown
2. Multi-file review: Switch between files → add comments on different files → verify all stored
3. Collapse workflow: Start collapsed → expand specific function → add comment → collapse again
4. Selection workflow: Navigate to line → start selection → extend selection → add multi-line comment
5. View toggle workflow: Review in split view → toggle to unified → continue reviewing
6. Search-like workflow: Use file list to jump to specific file → navigate to specific line
7. Cancel workflow: Start comment → type text → escape → verify no comment created
8. Focus side workflow: Review deletion (old side) → tab to old → add comment on old side

These simulate real user sessions. Chain multiple sendKey/sendChar calls and verify final state matches expected outcome.
result:
Added comprehensive integration tests for all 8 user workflows:

1. Review workflow - open diff, navigate, add comment, export
2. Multi-file review - switch files, add comments on different files
3. Collapse workflow - use summary/collapse mode with comments
4. Selection workflow - multi-line selection with comments
5. View toggle workflow - switch between split/unified views with comments
6. File list workflow - use file list to jump to specific file
7. Cancel workflow - escape without submitting comment
8. Focus side workflow - toggle between old/new sides for comments

All tests verify end-to-end user journeys with state assertions. Test suite now has 173 passing tests.

name: Add selection system tests

1. Space bar toggles selection_start at current cursor position
2. Shift+Up/Down extends selection from selection_start
3. Plain arrow movement (without shift) clears selection
4. Selection persists while moving with shift held
5. Escape clears selection

name: Add edge case tests
description:
Test boundary conditions and unusual inputs. Key scenarios:

1. Empty file (0 lines) - should render without crashing
2. Single line file - cursor bounds, no scrolling needed
3. Binary file (is_binary=true) - no diff lines generated
4. Very long lines (>terminal width) - truncation or wrapping
5. Unicode/UTF-8 content - proper character handling
6. Terminal too small (<40 width or <5 height) - shows 'Terminal too small' message
7. File with no changes (all context lines)
8. File with only one type of change (all additions or all deletions)
9. Very large file (1000+ lines) - scrolling and performance
10. Many files in session (20+) - file list navigation
11. Deep nesting in collapse regions (3+ levels)
12. Input buffer at max capacity (4096 bytes)

These tests ensure robustness. Use TestRunner with various extreme configurations.
